title: Ex-Dortmund translator reveals all on Dembele's strike to force £96m Barcelona move
text:
Former Borussia Dortmund translator Massimo Mariotti has lifted the lid on what really happened when Ousmane Dembele went AWOL to force a move to Barcelona.

Dembele's £96million transfer to the Nou Camp was one of the biggest deals of summer 2017, and the Frenchman did not leave Dortmund in the best light.

Upon hearing of Barcelona's desire to sign him, it was reported that Dembele disappeared from the club and could not be contacted in an attempt to seal his exit.

Ousmane Dembele joined Barcelona in a mega-money deal from Borussia Dortmund in 2017

It has been revealed that Dembele went AWOL for three days as Dortmund tried to keep him

Now, Borussia Dortmund's side of the story has come out, through the club's former translator Mariotti.

Speaking about the dramatic scenes, the man who was responsible for helping Dembele settle in Germany told Goal: 'Everyone came to me and asked where he was. But I didn't know either. I tried to reach him and his cousin, but that was in vain.

'They were both unavailable for three days. Somehow I had guessed at the time that he was no longer in Dortmund at all, so I went to his house and found out that he had gone to France with his mother in the morning.

Dembele played for Dortmund for a year, but it did not end amicably for him in Germany

Dembele has played 68 times since joining Barcelona but has been hampered by injuries

'Ousmane was really gone overnight and I was the only one who had contact with him later.

'I told him that he should come back, so that we could talk about things and he could understand BVB, that he must behave professionally. But it was already too late for that.'

Dembele has since played 68 times for Barcelona in the two seasons he has been there, but has also missed 46 through a series of injuries.
